334BABBBD9954DFFA8419163F349CD2F.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school  regularly consult authentic materials above one’s ability in order
to increase language proficiency.

F66DDDE1886242F9AC14BA195E4BB9BE.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school reflect and collect evidence on language acquisition goals to plan
one’s next steps in the language learning process.

CC477597CB6F4A0BA50A83053B19A7E1.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school  consult various sources in the target language to obtain
information on topics of personal interest

2635E906E80F4A38B15C7C814E90B70A.description: In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school d) set learning goals for language acquisition.

49C18479A33D43BD86C9EE1AE5271824.description: Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school identify music or songs in the target language.

66110265952045FFA8EE0F3B1C939005.description: Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school  exchange information about topics of personal interest

92E733B7522549E1AD7344D70C86CB4F.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school  interpret materials and/or media from the target language and
culture.

49AE762DBF0F4277A8B2F71E11608AB3.description: Use the target language for enrichment and advancement.

9E721103DDED42B781DC725894E01221.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school research opportunities to provide a service to the community
utilizing the target language (e.g., interpreting the target language
at a community event or clinic, create local maps, brochures, or
school/community announcements).

5F1460E6EB27478E8EC11FAFCF0F318F.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school discuss how to create a product (e.g., local maps, brochures,
health bulletins, school announcements) in the target language
for native consumers.

D016F78FD8604454A13E0AB9CF819FDE.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school explore real-world opportunities to connect with the target
language community

51EB9544A76C4ECC9C1188DED46F5002.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high school research the use of the target language in various fields of work
in today’s world.

B4E7039C4E2244709DD9CBCE83E6579D.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school interact with members of the local community or with contacts
made electronically to hear how they use the language (e.g., law
enforcement, interpreters, heritage speakers).

C8FB2591FED145E0AD0E8DE5A3BD75B5.description: In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school explore professions that require proficiency in another language

08E33B4EAE2040A683ABE39C2339E41E.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary school and middle school access speakers of the language either in person or using
technology.

853CEC6269524F589FF580C4984735F5.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary school and middle school research opportunities for participation in school, community, or
language competitions

77245392ADB549D89D269700B5AAE673.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary school and middle school identify places in the community where the target language is
spoken.

9161FC7823704917BFEA9B075E694900.description:
Use language to interact both within and beyond the
classroom.

AF7F9D78328B4B64815BF159D1ABD27A.description:
Advanced Learners in high school compare and contrast political systems in one’s own and the
target culture.

5C43A532CEB14F8298AC96F3760B8E2D.description:
Advanced Learners in high school draw conclusions about the impact of technology use in one’s
own and the target culture.

291BA5D8D2884FDBAC0CC022F2EC0AC8.description:
Advanced Learners in high school compare and contrast the importance placed on individual needs
versus community/global needs in one’s own and the target
culture.

784C8B6AC7EE4310B8774ED4CE5C5CC0.description:
Advanced Learners in high school explain attitudes toward health and wellness in one’s own and
the target culture.

FCED0CF395CE4D6E80DD51850C233EEF.description:
Advanced Learners in high school discuss the value placed on resources in one’s own and the
target culture.

6A03AEF72DAB46919199D6B750A04E41.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school explore entertainment and leisure options in one’s own and the
target culture.

BCC47790F2974237A1399AF6E15623F4.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school compare and contrast career choices and preparation in one’s
own and the target culture.

681D3495941648C7A684C818C88134B0.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school ) juxtapose school schedules, course offerings, and attitudes
toward school in one’s own and the target culture

022BF1F8FDDB46BDA365C6EDE1D23EF5.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school compare and contrast the role and importance of family in one’s
own and the target culture.

E9EE2B9C2108424693F812844157AF99.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school explore the origins and importance of cultural practices (e.g.,
holidays, celebrations, work habits) by comparing practices in
one’s own and the target culture.

C8FD9843C0184CA28BD324EA4C1F7253.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school discuss products’ origins and importance by comparing products
in the one’s own and the target culture.

68CDF371E0DE4974AC4CFC42A419045D.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school  contrast daily life, celebrations, and communities from the target
culture and one’s own.

882E48E04BA24B29A1FDD7156D73FF89.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school compare games, stories, songs, and rhymes from the target
culture and one’s own.

1BEC26DFC4804AF1B1A9CF0620D35D83.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school compare appropriate gestures to greet friends, family, or new
acquaintances in one’s own and the target culture

F0D95E328E63421DB9E4BB6B65ED9FCB.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school compare simple patterns of behavior or interaction in various
cultural settings (e.g., transportation to school, eating habits).

5A3F2D63B3284D8F94FA97A446215276.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school contrast tangible and intangible products of the target culture to
one’s own.

2F5A17E894F8457E827F476EC409FB28.description:
Investigate, explain, and reflect on the concept of culture
through comparisons of the target culture and one’s own.

C3E95AA44DB84283BA8B772502AFDCE4.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school analyze linguistic features and hypothesize how they may or may
not reflect the ways in which cultures organize information and
view the world.

9CF8CBF89D4B4DCCA10A3E13F6441A1C.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school compare linguistic elements that allow expression of time frames
(i.e., past, present, and future).

C4D9084702D748E596058B23B187A25A.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school investigate cognates that can have the same or different
meanings among languages and speculate about the evolution of
language over time.

43AA338795ED45F6933D2CA9537416E3.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school ) predict language origins based on awareness of cognates and
linguistic similarities.

89F825C9EF1B4BE8B9FB1DAC6F53BA9E.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school recognize on how different time frames are expressed in the
target language and one’s own.

92ECFEAAF9A04F5896CF0475EAEE8101.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school determine words in one’s own and target language that have no
direct translation.

8A37C565BA7B4C6F996D49B178CB116C.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school identify expressions that communicate respect and status in
one’s own and the target language.

B7A0D674D8C74A8A8501C09DB8AD48F4.description: In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school compare word order between one’s own and the target language.

57A0E955CEE44429A68DB23F0884E563.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school identify features of language specific to the target language that
may not exist in one’s own language (e.g., gender, tense,
character components).

4DB14B67999444AAA5807931C31DC07B.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school compare and contrast the sounds and writing systems of one’s
own language with the target language.

C4498221424C4A6FB9727704FD45B990.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school compare formal and informal speech in one’s own and target
language.

EBA70FE1FCA248DCB14205B8B9C844FB.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school identify idioms and their functions in one’s own language and
target language.

5CDCD8C1EC664D37A0056D0D6137F197.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school recognize and use words that are similar in the target language
and their one’s own language, and predict the reasons for
borrowing such words

D04E026426B6496BAB807520DAFD8E3A.description:
Investigate, explain, and reflect on the nature of language
through comparisons of the classical language and one’s
own.

8EECCB62E4594A20B6D1FB247CA2470E.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school examine literature or artwork from the target culture from a
historical perspective and explain the importance of the work to
the target culture.

FC991F3C1A744857AA699334444520C8.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school research and analyze an issue of global importance from the
perspective of the target countries.

39498A0CA6E2413F94AA66A62BA1CD04.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school  compare the perspective of local advertisements with
advertisements of the target culture.

177CC5DC89DE426CBCEAA9868C686963.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school  compare preferences related to daily life of the local community
to those of the target culture (e.g., music, movies, or leisure
activities).

9B539D1B602B4B63AEF6842AF98599C4.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school explore the various perspectives of a major figure in history,
science, or the arts from the perspective of the target culture

505D9E8C11B9463F933DC37F4951C84F.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school  describe a current event article or broadcast in the target
language and evaluate how it compares with the same event
reported in the United States.

30C13453CE6D4630A1776A6D24EB1B68.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school use age-appropriate authentic sources to prepare presentations
on familiar topics.

4411957C928B47E79AAF346CB1608FA0.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school identify the main idea of current events reported in news from the
target culture.

977A81D490544801B8D734A5506BDFBB.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school  use media from the target culture to increase knowledge of topics
from other content areas.

14AE20AAB2514CF2B3ACFD22F3E451A2.description: In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school  interpret information from infographics.

D263DEEFCB6941729C20758CB57A6ABB.description: Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school identify the content areas and expand on vocabulary for each

A0EF8DE1E2184A4CB190F53B7F0634D2.description:
Access and evaluate information and diverse perspectives
that are available through the target language and its
cultures.

1F53F51D3E7E43BBAD2CF450805CC5AC.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school research a historically significant innovation or invention, and
explain its impact on the target countries.

F6C91C01F1AC4723868B3DA826ADFBDA.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school examine different forms of government to compare how leaders
in target language countries are chosen or elected.

E246D87F0E96485D856B80A312BF8205.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school give and defend one’s opinion of media (e.g., movie, book) from
the target countries.

1F6889CFDFD14AADBEA260C4A7BAD98E.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school contrast examples of contemporary culture (e.g., sports, music,
art, architecture) from the target countries to one’s own.

A4800047F0DD4F79BF825FA8B9EEDEDA.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school compare attitudes and reactions regarding current events of
global importance.

01B23CDA1CBF4E479D6568FAE7A7D5A9.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school explain and sequence the significant events that shaped the
identity of the target countries

1A5806F3DE0A47BEBE5B93EB500F4700.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high
school ) relate topics from other content areas to the target culture.

22FDFAC359F84255B4C6FE839644283F.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school  identify and locate the target countries and their geographic
features on a map

1B8C73AA384B4EC19BEA3CC6125B91E3.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school explore people from the past and present who have had an
influence locally and/or globally.

A48A50D67B3A484F9451440E0CDF5E3E.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school compare typical food items from the target countries and one’s
own.

C867485EBF2141BE90002FA88F2404D4.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school observe climate around the world, giving reasons for weather
patterns based on location and time of year.

2E473004FCBD4EDB9AC5DDC17E3F612F.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school discuss currency exchange rates between the target countries
and the United States in order to understand the price of goods
and services

B7A53CDCB25245D794B787DE001A4A50.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school identify the various systems (i.e. measurement and time) used
throughout the target countries and in one’s own in order to
compare time, distance, and size.

3071CA15096F4472B7682E084AE6D24A.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school  use technology and resources introduced in other content areas
to explore authentic resources in the target language.

249E6B7D77964E1696480E3EE313EA7D.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school  read or listen to stories from the target culture and compare
them to familiar stories from the same genre (e.g., folklore,
fables, myths, legends).

BB5BE6BDB4F844AC8DC3C45F08042525.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school  identify items on charts or visuals used as instructional materials
in other content areas, such as math (e.g. measurements),
science (e.g. animals), the arts (e.g. musical instruments), and
social studies (e.g. geographical formations).

75B4A88DF87B48BFAB12950AE55183A3.description: Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school  identify the target countries on a map.

3123F9D004DF4DF19EC4E86627622943.description:
Build, reinforce, and expand knowledge of other content
areas while using the target language to develop critical
thinking and to solve problems creatively.

3FE811B19741412DB9619614FA3A74E5.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school identify and analyze the role and importance of cultural products
found in literature, news stories, and/or film.

C2F60211983743B68E8DE5A27AF72DE3.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school connect products to associated practices and give evidence-based
cultural insights about the target culture.

0CB7BC4E884443EE9070F1D58C669C23.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school use evidence-based details to explain and analyze the historical,
social, economic, and/or political significance of products found in the
target culture.

1591A4EAA440460CBC00667968274CFE.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school identify, research, and analyze the role and importance of tangible
and intangible products from the target culture.

37E7C78DB16F4DE6BBF2637065DB4EB3.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school describe how some cultural products have changed or disappeared
over time.

B4EE6A7B228C481995CA8C5D0BED56A1.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high school identify and analyze cultural products found in literature, news
stories, and films from the target culture.

D84D3B41F86A4ECA8773FBB875E1B6B7.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school explore (e.g., read, listen to, observe, perform) products of the target
culture and explain the origin and importance of these products
today

6AA976A38F8747EAA463B0E984965B01.description: Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school ) identify and investigate the function of products of the target culture

3CBB25243D8242EABEC3677B39412C4A.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school provide simple reasons for the role and importance of products from
the target culture.

217C2C88D9024A94AC0B86F88E99B642.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school identify the author and country of origin of short poems, stories, and
plays from the target culture.

66A54D1FDC7D4AD9A0A2E4F0E610C8DB.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school determine and discuss the perspective of artwork, crafts, or graphic
representations common within the peer group of the target culture.

E031E914235F4298ACCE4AD867F14A23.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school identify tangible and intangible products of the target culture and their
purpose

0D945E6719FD4AB0A445AAE867D0F3F7.description:
Investigate, explain, and reflect on the relationship between
products and perspectives of the culture(s) studied.

913BB4ED82EE460EBF4F4FC5A22D738D.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school make inferences about cultural perspectives, based on associated
practices.

26A0941C10E64277AED7407BBA01FC49.description: Advanced Range Learners in high school use language and message appropriately for the intended audience

221695CF7CC04537B069844A40C4FF3A.description:
Advanced Range Learners in high school simulate culturally appropriate behaviors in a variety of settings,
authentic or simulated, pertaining to the target culture.

FBED9648B3064A95AA11956B2321127B.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high school begin to adjust language and message to acknowledge audiences
with different cultural backgrounds.

C9EA454EBAA64F2A8F9432C092C6D5C6.description:
In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high school interact with peers or the peer group of the target culture to
demonstrate an awareness of culturally respectful behavior.

E1E207931CC348D3B32819906CDAA5F0.description: In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high school simulate culturally appropriate community interactions.

03D642A9F4284C3FB31CE6CCC7315669.description: In addition to the above, Intermediate Range Learners in high school ) identify and analyze cultural practices using authentic materials.

B04DFA8D04E64E148B505BD09F61D85D.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school  investigate, draw comparisons between, and explain the
interaction of practices and perspectives of the cultures studied.

C4FEF46C57AB4AB1BBB0FA2EB182C6CF.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school observe or identify a variety of authentic or simulated age appropriate cultural activities (e.g., games, sports, or
entertainment).

4B6C3DF7C3F84CCC8CAFF3DC017D272A.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school identify and begin to use both formal and informal methods to
interact with peers and adults.

BC222D9E053B4EF581164A366FD0E53A.description:
Intermediate Range Learners in elementary and middle school examine, analyze, and exchange information on patterns of
behavior typical of their peer group in the target culture.

4834961A7F134E0283AC82A97DE36BD7.description:
In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school identify cultural practices from authentic materials (e.g., videos
or news articles).

03CDC5472FE0416B8602F9CB12D514C8.description: In addition to the above, Novice Range Learners in high school simulate age-appropriate practices from the target culture.

CAFE78D3602D49D98F110295A26AA612.description: Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school identify characteristics of culturally specific events.

9428ECF3234E44099C83D221BB7CF6B7.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school list practices and ask simple questions after viewing media
about everyday life.

3D9FFAED083D4BAEAA642523D710B753.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school use words and phrases to describe what people from the target
culture are doing in texts or visual media (e.g., images, film, vase
paintings, statues).

89A84A27328A432994BB2257A5261EBF.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school identify authentic or simulated age-appropriate cultural
activities (e.g., games or birthday celebrations).

B8E020C8E51948DA9A40142FDBD5EE08.description:
Novice Range Learners in elementary and middle school use appropriate gestures and oral expressions in social
interactions.

9C65283C41694C3DA1AF705E888514E7.description:
Investigate, draw comparisons between, and explain the
interaction of practices and perspectives of the cultures studied.

40D736892B52410DA1DCB8A196EA52B1.description:
Advanced High Learners create sequences of complex sentences to write using the conventions of the target language and culture for
formal purposes.

97DEA69CB0BD494B931E55B259AF80BC.description:
Advanced High Learners create sequences of complex sentences to write using the conventions of the target language and culture to
present and elaborate on a point of view

978002A95F5E47F8A6A38198CBD3F505.description:
Advanced Mid Learners create sequences of detailed sentences to write well-organized texts for a variety of academic, professional,
and social purposes

8A0D9562696F41B7B371ADB2E07C25F5.description: Advanced Low Learners create sequences of sentences to indicate various time frames with regular success.

0DB2366917F94B379FE0222F0CB2A0BD.description:
Advanced Low Learners create sequences of sentences to conduct basic career tasks (e.g., memo, multi-step project plan,
resumé).

CEDD7ABF2B104E0D95C861E9D42D1FED.description:
Advanced Low Learners create sequences of sentences to respond to basic social and civic issues (e.g., letter to the editor,
letter of advice, online journal, online discussion forum).

4E0684801BD34DBCAAB379CE11F6B1DC.description:
Advanced Low Learners create sequences of sentences to conduct basic academic tasks (e.g., peer review, essay revisions,
note taking).

2680BAD19C3743E1A2A3905D085954EC.description: Intermediate High Learners create and connect sentences to indicate various time frames with some success.

FF137007594C44AAACCC8E2E1E958615.description:
Intermediate High Learners create and connect sentences to research a problem or topic (e.g. academic, career, community,
entertainment, or social).

F64522C42F144CBEB5D838E50DD89193.description: Intermediate Mid Learners create and begin to connect sentences to  indicate various time frames with occasional success.

BE545FE8F65F4BC5921749DAD3D4326D.description: Intermediate Mid Learners create and begin to connect sentences to create communications for an authentic audience

C56EF3C5D85D40589DD2608E3B414351.description:
Intermediate Mid Learners create and begin to connect sentences to compose a simple paragraph about a learned or researched
topic.

DCB98A51F8734D5C81A51DB4F9F59F7F.description: Intermediate Mid Learners create and begin to connect sentences to write messages, announcements, and invitations.

75B9C001F64F440BB9F28F853174D199.description:
Intermediate Low Learners create basic sentences to use practiced or memorized expressions to begin to indicate
various time frames.

8160631544FF473C81C289CA954A22CF.description: Intermediate Low Learners create basic sentences to ask questions to obtain information

CF7AFF9ACFC942B882BCB908FE09B0E6.description: Intermediate Low Learners create basic sentences to write about topics of student interest

F6E1B1CFA338419B9A1B88E903E1831B.description: Intermediate Low Learners create basic sentences to give basic instructions on how to make or do something.

0B930C645B494721ACFA77D03464C4C2.description: Intermediate Low Learners create basic sentences to prepare materials for a presentation.

354CD84BC0FF41E7A5927EACAD88CAE5.description: Intermediate Low Learners create basic sentences to describe people, activities, events, and experiences.

2DD6308EB972404895AC478ECBB69949.description: Novice High Learners begin to use simple sentences to ask for basic information.

853FB94540D64E77949B9E3B32069D42.description: Novice High Learners begin to use simple sentences to describe a familiar experience or event using practiced material.

75CC290733C141178D9BC086C122689D.description: Novice High Learners begin to use simple sentences to describe daily life in a letter, email, blog, or discussion board.

EBF6E74E20BD4C9DA1135057A6ABE96A.description: Novice Mid Learners use memorized words and phrases to make lists that aid in day-to-day life.

BB3B2F27BC09412CA3CCBD56282F014F.description: Novice Mid Learners use memorized words and phrases to ) write about oneself.

336E7C3AF85347D2A5A907994926540F.description: Novice Mid Learners use memorized words and phrases to fill out a simple form with some basic personal information.

3DCA065E336D4E2585D30B22A49B2663.description: Novice Low Learners use memorized words and some phrases to label familiar people, places, and objects in pictures and posters.

88DDB914C05248A992CC6E6C5A1B80BD.description:
Novice Low Learners use memorized words and some phrases to copy some letters, words, and phrases presented from a variety
of texts.

32C41F63931E4381BEF03D030DFF557E.description:
Present information on multiple topics for a variety of
purposes using appropriate formats, considering the
intended audience.

3CC4B996BEB24C07B6CBAB62B798716E.description:
Advanced High Learners create sequences of complex sentences to use culturally authentic presentational conventions and
strategies

1DE1B402B7334CEDB8F1516BB56137C4.description:
Advanced High Learners create sequences of complex sentences to  utilize precise language to clearly present a viewpoint with
supporting arguments on a complex issue.

DEFA8CD7C3284F97818AE8530A15FD92.description: Advanced High Learners create sequences of complex sentences to  present detailed information on abstract topics and issues.
